00054   /*
00055    * This function will be called back by Ffmpeg anytime
00056    * it wants to log.  We then use it to dump
00057    * stuff into our own logs.
00058    */
00059   static void
00060   xuggler_log_callback(void* ptr, int level, const char* fmt, va_list va)
00061   {
00062     static Logger* ffmpegLogger = 0;
00063     AVClass* avc = ptr ? *(AVClass**)ptr : 0;
00064 
00065     int currentLevel = av_log_get_level();
00066 //    fprintf(stderr, "current level: %d; log level: %d\n", level, currentLevel);
00067     if (level > currentLevel || currentLevel < AV_LOG_PANIC)
00068       // just return
00069       return;
00070 
00071     if (!ffmpegLogger)
00072     {
00073       Global::lock();
00074       if (!ffmpegLogger)
00075         ffmpegLogger = Logger::getStaticLogger( "org.ffmpeg" );
00076       Global::unlock();
00077     }
00078 
00079     Logger::Level logLevel;
00080     if (level <= AV_LOG_ERROR)
00081       logLevel = Logger::LEVEL_ERROR;
00082     else if (level <= AV_LOG_WARNING)
00083       logLevel = Logger::LEVEL_WARN;
00084     else if (level <= AV_LOG_INFO)
00085       logLevel = Logger::LEVEL_INFO;
00086     else if (level <= AV_LOG_DEBUG)
00087       logLevel = Logger::LEVEL_DEBUG;
00088     else
00089       logLevel = Logger::LEVEL_TRACE;
00090 
00091     // Revise the format string to add additional useful info
00092     char revisedFmt[1024];
00093     revisedFmt[sizeof(revisedFmt)-1] = 0;
00094     if (avc)
00095     {
00096       snprintf(revisedFmt, sizeof(revisedFmt), "[%s @ %p] %s",
00097           avc->item_name(ptr), ptr, fmt);
00098     }
00099     else
00100     {
00101       snprintf(revisedFmt, sizeof(revisedFmt), "%s", fmt);
00102     }
00103     int len = strlen(revisedFmt);
00104     if (len > 0 && revisedFmt[len-1] == '\n')
00105     {
00106       revisedFmt[len-1]=0;
00107       --len;
00108     }
00109     if (len > 0)
00110       // it's not useful to pass in filenames and line numbers here.
00111       ffmpegLogger->logVA(0, 0, logLevel, revisedFmt, va);
00112   }
00113 
00114   static int xuggler_interrupt_cb(void)
00115   {
00116     JNIHelper* helper = JNIHelper::getHelper();
00117     int retval = 0;
00118     if (helper) {
00119       retval = helper->isInterrupted();
00120     }
00121     return retval;
00122   }
00123   
00124   static int xuggler_lockmgr_cb(void** ctx, enum AVLockOp op)
00125   {
00126     if (!ctx)
00127       return 1;
00128     
00129     int retval=0;
00130     com::xuggle::ferry::Mutex* mutex=
00131       static_cast<com::xuggle::ferry::Mutex*>(*ctx);
00132     switch(op)
00133     {
00134       case AV_LOCK_CREATE:
00135         mutex = com::xuggle::ferry::Mutex::make();
00136         *ctx = mutex;
00137         retval = !!mutex;
00138         break;
00139       case AV_LOCK_DESTROY:
00140         if (mutex) mutex->release();
00141         *ctx = 0;
00142         break;
00143       case AV_LOCK_OBTAIN:
00144         if (mutex) mutex->lock();
00145         break;
00146       case AV_LOCK_RELEASE:
00147         if (mutex) mutex->unlock();
00148         break;
00149     }
00150     return retval;
00151   }
00152   
00153   Global* Global :: sGlobal = 0;
00154 
00155   void
00156   Global :: init()
00157   {
00158     if (!sGlobal)
00159     {
00160       av_lockmgr_register(xuggler_lockmgr_cb);
00161       av_log_set_callback(xuggler_log_callback);
00162       av_log_set_level(AV_LOG_ERROR); // Only log errors by default
00163       av_register_all();
00164       // and set up the device library for webcam support
00165       avdevice_register_all();
00166       avio_set_interrupt_cb(xuggler_interrupt_cb);
00167       // turn down logging
00168       sGlobal = new Global();
00169     }
00170   }
00171 
00172   void
00173   Global :: destroyStaticGlobal(JavaVM*vm,void*closure)
00174   {
00175     Global *val = (Global*)closure;
00176     if (!vm && val) {
00177       av_lockmgr_register(0);
00178       delete val;
00179     }
00180   }
00181 
00182   Global :: Global()
00183   {
00184     com::xuggle::ferry::JNIHelper::sRegisterTerminationCallback(
00185         Global::destroyStaticGlobal,
00186         this);
00187     mLock = com::xuggle::ferry::Mutex::make();
00188   }
00189 
00190   Global :: ~Global()
00191   {
00192     if (mLock)
00193       mLock->release();
00194   }
00195   
00196   void
00197   Global :: lock()
00198   {
00199     Global::init();
00200     if (sGlobal && sGlobal->mLock)
00201       sGlobal->mLock->lock();
00202   }
00203 
00204   void
00205   Global :: unlock()
00206   {
00207     Global::init();
00208     if (sGlobal && sGlobal->mLock)
00209       sGlobal->mLock->unlock();
00210   }

00212   int64_t
00213   Global :: getVersion()
00214   {
00215     return ((int64_t)getVersionMajor())<<48 | ((int64_t)getVersionMinor())<<32 | (int64_t)getVersionRevision();
00216   }

00237   Global :: getVersionStr()

00267   void
00268   Global :: setFFmpegLoggingLevel(int32_t level)
00269   {
00270     Global::init();
00271     if (level < AV_LOG_PANIC)
00272       av_log_set_level(AV_LOG_QUIET);
00273     else if (level < AV_LOG_FATAL)
00274       av_log_set_level(AV_LOG_PANIC);
00275     else if (level < AV_LOG_ERROR)
00276       av_log_set_level(AV_LOG_FATAL);
00277     else if (level < AV_LOG_WARNING)
00278       av_log_set_level(AV_LOG_ERROR);
00279     else if (level < AV_LOG_INFO)
00280       av_log_set_level(AV_LOG_WARNING);
00281     else if (level < AV_LOG_VERBOSE)
00282       av_log_set_level(AV_LOG_INFO);
00283     else if (level < AV_LOG_DEBUG)
00284       av_log_set_level(AV_LOG_VERBOSE);
00285     else
00286       av_log_set_level(AV_LOG_DEBUG);
00287 //    fprintf(stderr, "FFmpeg logging level = %d\n", av_log_get_level());
00288   }
00289 }}}
